title: Index
name: Index
description:
Populates collections with indexed data. The cfindex and cfsearch tags encapsulate the
  indexing and searching utilities. Collections can be populated from text files in a directory
  you specify, or from a query generated by a query. Before you can populate a collection,
  you must create the collection using either the cfcollection tag or the Lucee Administrator. Use
  cfsearch to search collections you populate with cfindex.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: name of the variable generated by action "list" to return the query containing all indexes of a collection.

attributes.name: collection
attributes.description:
Specifies a collection name. If you are indexing an external collection external = "Yes",
	specify the collection name, including fully qualified path.

attributes.name: action
attributes.description: Specifies the index action.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Specifies the type of entity being indexed. Default is CUSTOM.

attributes.name: title
key
attributes.description:
- Absolute path and filename, if type = "file"
            - Absolute path, if type = "path"
            - A query column name (typically, the primary key column
                name), if type = "custom"
            - A query column name, if type = any other value

            This attribute is required for the actions listed, unless
            you intend for its value to be an empty string.

attributes.name: body
attributes.description:
- ASCII text to index
            - Query column name(s), if name is specified in query

            You can specify columns in a delimited list. For example:
            - emp_name, dept_name, location"

attributes.name: custom1
attributes.description:
A custom field you can use to store data during an indexing operation. Specify a query column
	name for type and a query name.

attributes.name: custom2
attributes.description:
A custom field you can use to store data during an indexing operation. Usage is the same as
	for custom1.

attributes.name: custom3
attributes.description:
A custom field you can use to store data during an indexing operation.
			Usage is the same as for custom1.

attributes.name: custom4
attributes.description:
A custom field you can use to store data during an indexing operation.
			Usage is the same as for custom1.

attributes.name: URLpath
attributes.description:
Specifies the URL path for files if type = "file" and type = "path". When the collection is
	searched with cfsearch, the pathname is automatically be prepended to filenames and returned as
	the url attribute.

attributes.name: extensions
attributes.description:
Specifies the comma-separated list of file extensions that Lucee uses to index files if
	type = "Path". Default is HTM, HTML, CFM, CFML, DBM, DBML.
	An entry of "*." returns files with no extension

attributes.name: query
attributes.description: Specifies the name of the query against which the collection is generated.

attributes.name: recurse
attributes.description:
Yes or No. Yes specifies, if type = "Path", that directories below the path specified in
	key are included in the indexing operation.

attributes.name: external
attributes.description: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

attributes.name: language
attributes.description: language used to index

attributes.name: category
attributes.description:
A string value that specifies one or more search categories
            for which to index the data. You can define multiple
            categories, separated by commas, for a single index.

attributes.name: categoryTree
attributes.description:
A string value that specifies a hierarchical category or
            category tree for searching. It is a series of categories
            separated by forward slashes ("/"). You can specify only
            one category tree.

attributes.name: status
attributes.description:
The name of the structure into which Lucee
            returns status information.

attributes.name: prefix
attributes.description: Specifies the location of files to index when the computer that contains the K2 Search Service is not the computer on which you installed Lucee, and when you index files with the type attribute set to path.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: the timeout in seconds for a single request of type url

attributes.name: throwontimeout
attributes.description: Specifies how timeout conditions are handled. If the value is true, an exception is enerated to provide notification of the timeout. If the value is No, execution continues. Default is no.
